title: Andricus quercuscalicis 20190517133209
description: The sexual generation gall of Andricus quercuscalicis is a very small gall found on the male catkins of Quercus cerris. The asexual (agamic) gall is the well known "Knopper Gall". This forms on the acorns of Quercus robur and Quercus petraea. This photograph shows  males of the sexual generation just emerged from the catkin galls of Quercus cerris. They wait for females to emerge and then mate with them. The females then fly off in search of Quercus robur/petraea oaks to lay eggs to produce the next asexual generation. The knopper galls.
label: Original
